examples: Get a load of George over there.
The incident was over in a twinkle.
Buses take priority over other vehicles on the road.
People held handkerchiefs over their mouths.
The chef drizzled cream over the warm apple pie.
words.defineEn: across from one side to the other
words.defineVi: từ bên này sang bên kia

examples: But at least I got to third base with you.
At least we know where we stand with Steven now.
There were at least forty people at the party, some of them gatecrashers.
If I were in her place, I would have at least apologized.
We all met that wolf in sheep's clothing I guess at least once a life.
words.defineEn: not smaller than the stated quantity, and possibly more
words.defineVi: không nhỏ hơn số lượng đã nêu, và có thể nhiều hơn

examples: The cameras clicked away.
The water boiled away.
The clock is ticking away.
The land dropped steeply away into a small valley.
She guessed the answer straight away.
words.defineEn: at a distance from a particular person, place, or thing
words.defineVi: ở một khoảng cách từ một người cụ thể, địa điểm, hoặc điều

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
Has your headache gone yet?
Has the postman been yet?
His parents have not yet reached retirement age.
Yet another candidate has thrown his hat into the ring.
words.defineEn: up to a particular point in time
words.defineVi: đến một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: The police closed in.
The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
In 2018 the party had 10 000 members.
The birds built their nest in the tree.
words.defineEn: into or inside of a place, object, or area
words.defineVi: vào hoặc bên trong một địa điểm, đối tượng hoặc khu vực

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Her true feelings were finally out in the open.
By that point in the argument, reason had gone out the window.
She knows the business inside out.
The jury is still out as concerns the location of the new station.
words.defineEn: in the opposite direction of the center of a place
words.defineVi: theo hướng ngược lại với trung tâm của một nơi

examples: The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
But that was a long time ago.
I had a brush with him a number of years ago.
He should have been given the boot years ago.
Until three years ago, I could have slept for England.
words.defineEn: used to refer to a time in the past, showing how much time has passed before the present moment
words.defineVi: dùng để chỉ một thời điểm trong quá khứ, cho thấy thời gian đã trôi qua bao lâu trước thời điểm hiện tại

examples: He danced the issue around.
The goldfish in the bowl was swimming around happily.
One of them was glancing nervously around.
A bus appeared around the corner.
People around the world enjoy various forms of music as a universal language.
words.defineEn: approximately or roughly
words.defineVi: xấp xỉ hoặc đại khái

examples: The children scarfed down the pizza at the birthday party.
Turn the mould upside down.
His parents are always breathing down his neck.
That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
A path led down the hill.
words.defineEn: at or toward a lower level or position
words.defineVi: tại hoặc hướng tới một mức độ thấp hơn hoặc vị trí

examples: The workers construct the building from the ground up.
The film ups the ante on special effects.
That accident battered up the door of my car.
The professor knew his subject from the ground up.
The coach always keeps a few tricks up his sleeve.
words.defineEn: at or toward a higher level or position
words.defineVi: ở hoặc hướng tới một cấp độ hoặc vị trí cao hơn

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định

examples: The actress was practicing her lines before the audition.
Her life had always run smoothly before.
We have had these mysteries before.
Have you ever used this software before?
The case was tried before a jury.
words.defineEn: at an earlier time
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm sớm hơn

examples: Winter brings a peaceful silence, especially after a fresh snowfall.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Women especially, are known to wear so many different hats, when it comes to our work and home life.
She's got a lot on her plate - especially with two new projects starting this week.
I usually like to be the person who holds down the fort, especially at work.
words.defineEn: used for showing that what we are saying is related to one thing or person more than others
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng những gì chúng ta đang nói có liên quan đến một điều hoặc người nhiều hơn những người khác

examples: The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
My father is quite old now
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
He plays quite well.
words.defineEn: to the highest degree
words.defineVi: ở mức độ cao nhất

examples: The Council of Ministers, however, is still putting a spanner in the works.
However, they quickly realized that their love and support for her shouldn't be affected by her sexual orientation.
However, with careful planning and sacrifices, she managed to make the trips of her dreams.
However, I did find Avery's reaction to catching him with his pants down to be pretty unrealistic.
However, creditors have better memory than debtors, and they will eventually come calling for what is owed to them.
words.defineEn: used to add a statement that contradicts what was just mentioned
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thêm một tuyên bố mâu thuẫn với những gì vừa được đề cập

examples: Though I still liked it.
Some of us, though, actually have to apply for jobs.
It looks to me as though the company is in real trouble.
John still carries a torch for Mary, even though they broke up years ago.
You look as though you slept badly.
words.defineEn: used to introduce a statement that makes the previous one less strong and therefore surprising
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu một tuyên bố làm cho tuyên bố trước kém mạnh mẽ hơn và do đó gây ngạc nhiên

examples: Take enough supplies.
Alright I had enough.
Are you warm enough?
Oh yes, enough said.
Even a dog knows enough to come out of the rain, Charlie.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is sufficient or necessary
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ đó là đủ hoặc cần thiết

examples: Tuesdays usually are my busiest days at work.
I usually have a peaceful sleep at night.
We usually have a family gathering on Thanksgiving.
The weather in this city is usually mild throughout the year.
The head teacher usually takes us for French.
words.defineEn: in most situations or under normal circumstances
words.defineVi: trong hầu hết các tình huống hoặc trong các trường hợp bình thường

examples: The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Your breakfast is coming soon.
Everyone within earshot soon knew her opinion of Reggie.
The army will soon make a man out of you.
My son is coming home soon.
words.defineEn: just after something else has happened or in a short time from now
words.defineVi: ngay sau khi một cái gì đó khác đã xảy ra hoặc trong một thời gian ngắn kể từ bây giờ

examples: The explanation went completely over my head.
My mouth felt completely dry.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The death of his wife broke him completely.
The millstone around my neck is choking me completely.
words.defineEn: to the greatest amount or extent possible; fully
words.defineVi: với số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn nhất có thể; đầy đủ

examples: The chairman's resignation finally brought matters to a head.
The negotiations between the two countries finally yielded a peace agreement.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
words.defineEn: after a long time, usually when there has been some difficulty
words.defineVi: sau một thời gian dài, thường là khi có một số khó khăn

examples: The faceplate is turned rather than cast.
I killed a rather good bottle of Fleurie.
I found her story rather hard to swallow.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
The company opted for a settlement rather than taking their former employee to court.
words.defineEn: to some extent or degree
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ nào đó hoặc mức độ

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: in a rapid or quick way
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng hoặc nhanh chóng

examples: Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
Obviously, over the years, this changed but my car remained behind the times with its cassette player.
He obviously didn’t realize he was swimming with sharks!
I was furious but just left it at that since he obviously didn't care about me.
And obviously, tons of people mistake Twitter bots for humans all the time.
words.defineEn: in a way that is easily understandable or noticeable
words.defineVi: theo cách dễ hiểu hoặc đáng chú ý

examples: The time passed quickly.
The cruise went very quickly.
The eggs cook quickly in a hot frying pan.
The worm turns quickly in the world of politics.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
words.defineEn: with a lot of speed
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều tốc độ
